story.l1: It was a dark and stormy (really!) Tuesday night...
story.l2: Joanna and Gabe first crossed paths at a fundraiser in midtown Manhattan. They bonded over a shared love of music and the arts—though they disagreed strongly on whether Lang Lang is a great pianist.
story.l3: After a few evenings exchanging Spotify lists, watching films, and discovering a shared appreciation for Eataly, Broadway, and cocktail bars—they knew they had found something special in each other. In the years since, they’ve called the diverse community of Long Island City home, while continuing to explore the arts and culinary scene in New York.
story.l4: In the fall of 2019, Gabe proposed during a candlelight cruise in the Riviera Maya, Mexico. A year later, Joanna and Gabe were married in an intimate ceremony on October 10, 2020 — as much fun as that was, they can’t wait to celebrate with all of their favorite people.
story.l5: They also still disagree on Lang Lang — although they both agree Martha Argerich is better anyway.

wedding.subt: All wedding activities will be at the same location. Doors open at 4:45 PM.

registry.l1:
Your presence is more than enough! We are truly blessed and just happy to celebrate with you. 

That said, we have a feeling that this won’t stop the very generous among you! From our registry link below, you'll be able to directly offset some of the costs from our upcoming getaway. If you do, just know that we are so grateful for your contribution! And if you don’t, that’s perfectly fine too.

lodging.subt: Below you’ll find room block information and some recommendations for quick bites in the neighborhood.

faq.subt:
We will be updating these regularly.
If you can’t find what you’re looking for, please reach out to us via
faq.q1: Do I need to be vaccinated to attend?
faq.a1:
Yes, guests age 12 and older will be required to show proof of vaccation.

Please refer to our
faq.a12: for additional information. If you have a medical condition that prevents you from getting the vaccine, pleae reach out to us.
faq.q2: What's the best way to reach you if we have questions?
faq.a2: Please reach us via the Contact Us section or email us directly at：
faq.a2-en: If you are unsure if we have your most up to date email, phone, or address, please reach out!
faq.q3: Will there be a Zoom or livestream of the wedding if I can’t make it?
faq.a3: No, we currently do not have plans to livestream the wedding.
faq.q4: What if you plan to postpone?
faq.a4:
While we don’t anticipate further postponement, we will be responsive to any circumstances that may impact the health and safety of our guests.

Any announcements about the status of the wedding will be posted on our website first. We plan to contact all guests via phone or other electronic means (email, DM, etc.) if there are urgent updates.

If you would like us to have your email or phone on file for the latest updates, please feel free to reach us via the Contact Us section or send us an email at
faq.a5: Our registry is available via the following link:
faq.a5-1: For further details, please see our
faq.a6:
For international guests planning to stay in New York City, John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK) or LaGuardia Airport (LGA) is likely to be your best option.

Domestic guests, especially those who are staying in New Jersey, may want to fly into Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR) instead.

 Otherwise, JFK is likely the best option for anyone staying in Manhattan or Queens.
faq.a7:
Black Tie. We understand that guidance on this dress code can be a little confusing, so we’d like to provide our preferred interpretation to help clarify. We request that guests wear:

- A formal floor-length gown, although a sophisticated cocktail dress mid-length or longer is suggested. Elegant pantsuits are also welcome.
- A dark tuxedo. A bow tie or slim necktie, as well as patent, velvet, or dark leather shoes, are strongly suggested. In lieu of a tuxedo, a dark-colored suit and crisp, white, collared shirt are acceptable—and a tie is essential.
- Comfortable dancing shoes are highly encouraged!

email.l1:
Questions? Recently moved? Let us know the latest. 
If available, please upload your COVID Vaccine Record(s) below. Your information will be kept confidential and help us ensure all attending guests' well-being.
email.upload: Choose the file(s) and don't forget to click Upload to finalize the file selection!

covid.subt:
We want to be upfront about the precautions we are taking to provide a safe and comfortable celebration for our family and friends. Following the latest guidelines in New York City, we have made updates to our policy as of August 2021.

The important things to know are:
covid.s-1: 1. All adult guests must be fully vaccinated and have received their second shot by November 5, 2021. Proof of vaccination is required.
covid.s-2: 2. We would love to have children at our wedding, but leave the decision with each family depending on your comfort level. If you plan to bring them, please let us know when you RSVP!
covid.s-3: 3. We will be doing temperature checks at the door.
covid.s-4: 4. All guests will need to wear face masks when not eating or drinking indoors.
covid.s-5: 5. All guests who are feeling unwell or symptomatic on the day of are encouraged to stay at home and celebrate from afar.
covid.note:
We know these precautions may be inconvenient, but there are no exceptions to these guidelines. We are also very mindful of everyone’s ability to make their own informed decision about vaccination for themselves and their family. In turn, we request careful compliance with precautions as outlined if you plan to attend.

Thank you in advance for your understanding. We kindly ask that you check this site regularly for updates as we get closer to November 20th, and we hope to celebrate with you soon!
covid.q-1: How frequently will you update these guidelines?
covid.a-1: We continue to make updates to our policy as we track vaccination rates, Delta variant trends, and the latest guidelines from health and government authorities in New York City. All guidance here is being reviewed on an ongoing basis as conditions change from week to week.
covid.q-2: Will we need to bring masks?
covid.a-2: Yes. We’ll be evaluating our stance on this and other COVID-related measures in partnership with our venue, Weylin. In general, you can expect that our mask policy will remain very similar to those found in the hospitality, travel, and restaurant industries in New York City.
covid.q-3: What if I forget to bring my mask?
covid.a-3: We will have a small supply of disposable masks as a precaution. You’re highly encouraged to bring your own mask, also so that you can coordinate it with your outfit.
covid.q-4: When will I need to wear a mask?
covid.a-4: Masks will need to be worn anytime you are not eating or drinking, or are moving around the venue away from your chair or designated table. We recognize this impacts dancing and moving about during reception, so we’re using feedback from Spring/Summer 2021 weddings to inform our approach in the fall.
covid.q-5: How is mask wearing going to be enforced?
covid.a-5: We plan to implement a three strike rule: a reminder, a warning, and then being escorted out of the venue. (So until our position on this changes, please wear a mask!)
covid.a-6:
Yes. Our venue, Weylin, has a maximum capacity which exceeds our guest count by a healthy margin. As a result, we are fortunate to have a bit more flexibility with our seating arrangements and event flow.

We’re excited to share more specifics as we get closer, which will be considered alongside our mask policy.
covid.q-7: Will COVID rapid or PCR testing before the wedding be required?
covid.a-7: Maybe. We don’t have enough information as of August 2021 to say for certain. Please stay tuned for more information as we track available options. We are closely following developments on the testing front, including but not limited to: speed of testing, cost of individual testing kits, and test efficacy in detecting SARS-Cov-2 and the Delta variant.
covid.q-8: I am fully vaccinated, do I need to present a negative test result?
covid.a-8:
Not as of August 2021. However, all guests must provide proof of vaccination. You can upload your vaccination records via our RSVP form or by emailing us at hello@joannaandgabriel.love. We will be collecting vaccination details on a rolling basis from guests.

If you have taken a vaccine that requires a series (Pfizer or AstraZeneca), you will need to have completed both shots. For those who have taken the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, proof of vaccination is sufficient.
covid.q-9: What if I have not been vaccinated or don’t plan to be?
covid.a-9:
As of August 16, 2021 we are requiring all adult guests in attendance to be vaccinated.
We continue to evaluate if testing will be a further precaution we take, but full vaccination is required either way.
covid.q-10: What kind of COVID tests will be required?
covid.a-10:
For non-vaccinated guests, we will require either of the following at the door prior to entering the venue.

1. A negative PCR test. Results must be returned within 72 hours of our wedding start time. Test results from before 5pm EST on November 17th will not be valid.
2. A negative rapid test. Results must be returned within 6 hours of our wedding start time. Test results from before 11am EST on November 20th will not be valid.
covid.q-11: What if I take a PCR test prior to the wedding and it comes back too early? What if it doesn’t come in time at all?
covid.a-11:
As a precaution, we are working on fall-back options for rapid testing.

We expect COVID testing will become cheaper and more accessible by later this year. If so, we hope to make those options available to our guests if the economics allow. That said, we believe full vaccination will be the best and safest way to enjoy our wedding, and highly encourage it even outside of our event.
covid.q-12: What if I took a test and it came back negative, but I am feeling sick or unwell?
covid.a-12: As a precaution, we kindly ask that you stay home—both for your own health and for those at the event.
covid.a-13:
Our vendors have all been thoughtful and gracious partners in making our event safe and successful.

For vendors who are handling food or who will be interacting with guests, heightened precautions have been proposed above and beyond their standard food safety procedures.

We also intend to incorporate the most effective strategies used at various indoor weddings earlier in the year into our own preparations for November. We look forward to sharing more specific details as we finalize those strategies with Weylin and our vendor partners.
covid.q-14: Do I need to be vaccinated to attend?
covid.a-14:
Yes. We will be requiring full vaccination for all adults in attendance as of August 16, 2021.
If you have a medical condition that prevents you from getting the vaccine, please reach out to us.

This is the date the “Key to the City” vaccination mandate went into effect for indoor dining and entertainment venues in New York City.
Please plan to provide proof of vaccination with your RSVP or in advance of the wedding.

In addition to the RSVP form, you can always email us proof of vaccination at hello@joannaandgabriel.love. 
You are also encouraged to bring your proof of vaccination with you.

Kindly note that as the vaccination mandate applies across venues in New York City, providing proof of vaccination is a policy that our venue security detail will be enforcing very seriously.
covid.a-15:
As of August 2021, CDC guidelines indicate that “the greatest risk of [COVID] transmission is among unvaccinated people who are much more likely to contract, and therefore transmit the virus.” This is the single biggest step we feel we can take to help reduce any transmission risk during the wedding, in addition to all other precautions listed as part of this policy.

In addition, guests who are considered vulnerable may be in attendance: our elders, parents and caregivers in regular contact with young children, and expecting mothers. We believe precautions like full vaccination for adults are especially important for reducing risk on their behalf.
covid.q-16: Are children allowed at the wedding?
covid.a-16: Yes. We’d love to host your children at the wedding! However, we leave it up to each family to decide their own level of comfort with bringing kids to our celebration. If helpful, we are happy to share trends and feedback from other parents if you'd like to contact us for more information.
